Key Match Events: Teboho Mokoena scored a brace, including a thunderous half-volley into the far corner
Fans invaded the pitch twice during the game
Pre-Game Insights: Hugo Broos reiterated that they cannot afford to underestimate Congo-Brazzaville
Congo national football team head coach Issac Ngata explained the reasons behind the delayed arrival of his team
Post-Match Reflections: Teboho Mokoena was the main act for this game given his performance from start to finish
He was duly the Man of the Match and given a standing ovation when he was withdrawn
Miscellaneous Highlights: The people of Gqeberha came out in numbers, filling up the venue to the rafters
The game was stopped in the first half due to supporters invading the pitch
Others: Bafana Bafana moved one step closer to 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualification
Themba Zwane will achieve a milestone should he play against Congo Brazzaville
